headline: This Energy Stock Just Tanked. Here’s Why.
summary: Shares of specialty chemical company  Johnson Matthey  plunged at the start of a new week of trading after investors realized it would not receive as much as expected from an asset sale.  Honeywell  is on the other side of the transaction, so Johnson’s loss is their win.  The changes in value don’t exactly line up, however, which tells investors something about the stock market.

headline: Johnson Matthey cuts sale price of CT division by over a quarter to £1.3bn
summary: Johnson had originally struck a deal in May to sell its CT arm to Honeywell for £1.8 billion including debts.

headline: Johnson Matthey Lowers Price of Unit Being Sold to Honeywell to $1.8 Billion
summary: Johnson Matthey cut the price of the catalysts technologies unit that it is selling to Honeywell International by more than a quarter and extended the deadline for the closure of the deal.

headline: Honeywell Takes $640 Million Axe To Johnson Matthey Deal
summary: Honeywell (NASDAQ: HON) announced an amended agreement to acquire Johnson Matthey's Catalyst Technologies business.

raw.headline: Honeywell Takes $640 Million Axe To Johnson Matthey Deal
raw.summary: Honeywell (NASDAQ: HON) announced an amended agreement to acquire Johnson Matthey's Catalyst Technologies business.

headline: Honeywell Enters Into Amended Agreement to Acquire Johnson Matthey's Catalyst Technologies Business
summary: Honeywell (NASDAQ: HON) today announced that it has entered into an amended agreement to acquire Johnson Matthey's Catalyst Technologies business segment, which adjusts the total consideration from £1.8 billion to £1.325 billion and extends the long stop date to July 21, 2026. In the event that any of the regulatory approvals are not satisfied by the long stop date, the long stop date may be extended to August 21, 2026, if certain conditions are met.
